comments: a(n) is the number of Dyck (n+2)-paths with UU spanning the midpoint. e.g. for n=2 the two Dyck 4-paths are UUDU.UDDD and UDUU.UDDD where dot marks the midpoint. - _David Scambler_, Feb 11 2011Apparently the number of returns to the left of or at the midpoint of all Dyck paths with semilength n+1. - _David Scambler_, Apr 30 2013
links: Alon Regev, The central component of a triangulation, arXiv preprint arXiv:1210.3349 p. 6.
prog: (Sage)def C(n): return binomial(2*n,n)/(n+1)  # Catalan numbersdef A027302(n): return add(C(k)*C(n+1-k) for k in (1..(n+1)/2))[A027302(n) for n in (1..22)]  # _Peter Luschny_, Jun 27 2013
author: _Clark Kimberling_
